The MP9 is a compact and versatile selective-fire submachine gun renowned for its reliability and ergonomic design by Brugger and Thomet, as a development of the Steyr TMP, purchased from Steyr in 2001. The MP9 is made of polymer, corrosion-resistant, with a folding stock and an integrated Picatinny rail. Its design and ease of operability allows the user to holster the weapon like a machine pistol or personal defense weapon for rapid deployment in self-defence, and has gained popularity as a reliable firearm in military and law enforcement circles. The MP9-N is a refined variant with an increased fire rate, effective as PDW or for concealed carry for security and bodyguards.

 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] All collimators for the Picatinny/weaver system.
